metadata.title: Projects Eligible for Over-the-Counter (OTC) Permit
notes: Lists are described as 'include, but are not limited to' — edge cases exist
The implicit operational criterion is the 'one-hour rule': if plan review at each station cannot be completed within approximately one hour, the project goes to in-house review
Any OTC application can be reassigned to in-house review if it lacks required details or contains conflicting or incorrect information
Some no-plan items (skylights, windows, siding) must now be filed online through PermitSF rather than in person

routing_decision.question: Can plan review at each station be completed within approximately one hour?
routing_decision.caveat: This is an implicit operational criterion, not formally codified as a hard threshold in public documents

otc_without_plans.description: Simplest permits — no drawings required, issued same day

projects.description: Re-roofing
In-kind skylight replacement (same size and location)
In-kind repair decks and/or stairs (less than 50%)
In-kind window replacement (same size and same location)
In-kind exterior siding repair and/or replacement
In-kind minor dry rot repair
In-kind kitchen remodel (no changes to the floor plan or walls)
In-kind bathroom remodel (no change to the floor plan or walls)
In-kind replacement of garage doors (same size and same location)
Exploratory work to determine depth of footing, stud size/spacing, floor/roof joist size and direction
projects.notes: Holes to be filled with slurry, finishes replaced with same fire resistance rating

projects.description: Replacement of wall finishes in R-3 occupancies complying with SFEBC Section 503.11.1
Bolting down existing foundation and/or adding plywood panels to crawl space/1st floor garage area
projects.notes: NOT complying with DBI Information Sheet IS-09 (S-09)

otc_with_plans.description: Plans required, reviewed at counter stations in approximately one hour per station

projects.description: Kitchen remodel (changing layout, floor plan or removing walls)
Bathroom remodel (changing layout, floor plan or removing walls)
Residential interior remodel (changing floor plans or removing walls)
Repairing decks and/or stairs (more than 50%)
New windows and/or exterior doors in new locations
New skylights in new locations
Decks less than 20 feet above grade that meet Planning Department setbacks
Sign permits
Single story non-structural commercial tenant improvement projects
Permits to comply with accessibility requirements
Installation of power door operators
Voluntary structural strengthening
Disability access barrier removal projects
Small to medium projects that do not require Planning Department neighborhood notification
Fences taller than 6 feet in side or rear yard and/or fences taller than 3 feet in front yard
Exterior facade work, visible from street, that involves changes in finishes
projects.examples: stucco to siding, wood to vinyl

projects.description: New mechanical equipment installed inside or outside the building
Storefront security gates
Residential security gates at entry doors and/or window security bars, grills, and/or grates
Replacement of wall finishes in occupancies other than R-3
New washer, dryer, and/or laundry sink hookups in new/existing areas within existing building
In-kind replacement of garage slab (no ceiling height changes)
projects.notes: Saw-cutting SOG to repair/replace sewer lines does not require plans

projects.description: Brace and bolt per DBI Information Sheet S-09
Removal of Underground Storage Tanks

not_otc_requires_inhouse.description: These projects require In-House Review — cannot be processed over the counter

projects.description: Change of use tenant improvements involving Family Day Care, 'E' occupancies, and Laboratory uses
Serial permitting that continues to increase the scope of the initial remodel
Foundation replacements and/or seismic upgrades when there is a prior permit for further expansion under review
Projects in hillside or landslide areas requiring geotechnical report, third-party engineering review, or Structural Advisory Committee review
projects.includes: earthquake-induced landslide zones, Northwest Mount Sutro, or Edgehill Mountain Slope Protection Areas

projects.description: Excavation projects that expand the below-grade footprint
Extensive residential remodels that change gravity load-carrying members
Extensive residential remodels that require mandatory seismic upgrade on all levels
Special (non-conventional) foundation systems including tie backs, deep foundations, and/or complex shoring systems
Extensive commercial tenant improvements that change gravity load-carrying members
Tower Crane installation permits
Adding and/or removal of units
ADU or unit legalization
Advertising Billboard removal
Change of use from partial restaurant to full restaurant
Housing projects
MOU projects
Revision permit to remove sprinkler from Issued Building Permit
Revision to Site permit
Creation and/or legalization of one or more housing units

additional_inhouse_criteria.note: These are commonly cited but not on the official sf.gov page — may be derived from practice rather than policy
projects: Exterior work on Historic Resource Buildings
New stairs, decks, and firewalls exceeding 10 feet in height
Interior remodels involving demolition of more than 75% of interior walls

otc_to_inhouse_conversion.trigger: If an application lacks required details or contains conflicting or incorrect information, it will be reassigned for in-house review
otc_to_inhouse_conversion.note: An OTC application can be required to convert to In-House Review at any time
